required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of BBP-711 (ORF-229) in Healthy Adult Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blinded, Placebo-controlled, Single and Multiple-Ascending Dose Study of the Safety, Tolerability, Food Effect, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of BBP-711 (ORF-229) in Healthy Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of BBP-711 in healthy adult volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-center, two-part, randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled, ascending dose study of BBP-711 in healthy male and female adult volunteers. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of BBP-711 in healthy adult volunteers. Each volunteer will participate in the study for about 20 days.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples will be taken pre-dose up to Day 10 for SAD and pre-dose up to Day 20 for MAD
Blood samples will be taken pre-dose up to Day 10 for SAD and pre-dose up to Day 20 for MAD
Blood samples will be taken pre-dose up to Day 10 for SAD and pre-dose up to Day 20 for MAD
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to last measurable concentration (AUC(0-last)) computed using the linear trapezoidal rule

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic Assessment: Percentage change from baseline plasma glycolate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples will be taken pre-dose up to Day 10 for SAD and pre-dose up to Day 20 for MAD
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline plasma glycolate

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic Assessment: Baseline 24 Hour urinary glycolate:creatinine ratio
Pharmacodynamic Assessment: Percentage change from baseline of 24 Hour urinary glycolate:creatinine ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Urine samples will be taken pre-dose up to Day 3 for SAD and pre-dose up to Day 7 for MAD
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline of 24 Hour urinary glycolate:creatinine ratio

arm_group.description: A single dose of BBP-711 will be administered orally.
A single dose of matching placebo will be administered orally.
A dose of BBP-711 will be administered orally for multiple days.
A dose of matching placebo will be administered orally for multiple days.
A single dose of BBP-711 will be administered orally.
A single dose of matching placebo will be administered orally.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult male or female who is 18 to 65 years old,
- Weight >50 kg and â‰¤110 kg at Screening
- Body mass index (BMI) 20 to 32 kg/m2, inclusive, at Screening
- In generally good health
- Nonsmoker, or not using tobacco or nicotine-containing products for at least 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any over-the-counter medications, including herbals or routine vitamins or minerals, or other supplements, within 7 days before admission to the research center.
- Pregnant or breastfeeding
- eGFR <90 mL/minute
- Abnormal ECG
- Abnormal laboratory results
- Positive test result for HIV, Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, or COVID-19
- History of substance dependency (alcohol or other drugs of abuse) in the last 2 years
- Use of study drug in any clinical trial within 30 days of admission to the research center, or in the active follow-up phase of another clinical trial involving study drug
